intro: Rebutia krainziana var. hyalacantha, commonly known as the Hyalacantha Rebutia, is a succulent plant native to the arid regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rounded growth habit and pale green to bluish-green stems. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red, typically during the spring and summer months. Its thick, fleshy stems are adapted to store water, making it drought-tolerant and suitable for rock gardens or containers. The varietal name "hyalacantha" refers to its translucent or glassy appearance, particularly in the stems.
